revised_title: A Detailed Account of Earthquake Shocks in Newbury, New England
tldr: The author, Matthias Plant, provides a detailed account of the earthquake shocks experienced in Newbury, New England, from 1727 to 1741. The earthquakes were felt throughout the region, causing damage to buildings, opening the ground in some areas, and drying up springs. The author also mentions the impact of the earthquake in other locations, such as Boston, Piscataqua, Mountreal, and New-York.
